documents.content: 41-year-old female presents for removal of benign nevus on left upper back. Procedure: Excision of 1.5cm nevus with 3mm margins. LOCAL ANESTHESIA: 5cc of 1% lidocaine with epinephrine injected locally. Patient tolerated procedure well under local anesthesia. Simple layered closure with 4-0 sutures. No complications. Patient discharged home in stable condition. Specimen sent to pathology.
